member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue
member.summary: Represents the Cache-Control HTTP header.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.PublicString
member.summary: A constant for the public cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.PrivateString
member.summary: A constant for the private cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxAgeString
member.summary: A constant for the max-age cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.SharedMaxAgeString
member.summary: A constant for the s-maxage cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoCacheString
member.summary: A constant for the no-cache cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoStoreString
member.summary: A constant for the no-store cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStaleString
member.summary: A constant for the max-stale cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MinFreshString
member.summary: A constant for the min-fresh cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoTransformString
member.summary: A constant for the no-transform cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.OnlyIfCachedString
member.summary: A constant for the only-if-cached cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MustRevalidateString
member.summary: A constant for the must-revalidate cache-control directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.ProxyRevalidateString
member.summary: A constant for the proxy-revalidate cache-control directive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoCache
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the no-cache directive.
Configuring no-cache indicates that the client must re-validate cached responses with the original server before using it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoCacheHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of field names in the "no-cache" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP response.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoStore
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the no-store directive.
Configuring no-store indicates that the response may not be stored in any cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxAge
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the max-age directive.
max-age specifies the maximum amount of time the response is considered fresh.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.SharedMaxAge
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the s-maxage directive.
Overrides max-age, but only for shared caches (such as proxies).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStale
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the max-stale is included.
max-stale that the client will accept stale responses. The maximum tolerance for staleness is specified by .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MaxStaleLimit
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the max-stale directive.
Indicates the maximum duration an HTTP client is willing to accept a response that has exceeded its expiration time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MinFresh
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the min-fresh directive.
Indicates the freshness lifetime that an HTTP client is willing to accept a response.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.NoTransform
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the no-transform request directive.
Forbids intermediate caches or proxies from editing the response payload.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.OnlyIfCached
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the only-if-cached request directive.
Indicates that the client only wishes to obtain a stored response

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.Public
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the public response directive is included.
Indicates that the response may be stored by any cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.Private
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the private response directive is included.
Indicates that the response may not be stored by a shared cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.PrivateHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of field names in the "private" directive in a cache-control header field on an HTTP response.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.MustRevalidate
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the must-revalidate response directive is included.
Indicates that caches must revalidate the use of stale caches with the origin server before their use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.ProxyRevalidate
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the proxy-validate response directive is included.
Indicates that shared caches must revalidate the use of stale caches with the origin server before their use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.Extensions
member.summary: Gets cache-extension tokens, each with an optional assigned value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.Parse(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Parses as a value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue.TryParse(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.CacheControlHeaderValue@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the specified as a .
member.returns: if input is a valid , otherwise .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue
member.summary: Represents the value of a Content-Disposition header.
member.remarks: Note this is for use both in HTTP (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6266) and MIME (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2183)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: A that represents a content disposition type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.DispositionType
member.summary: Gets or sets a content disposition type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters included the Content-Disposition header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the content body part.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that suggests how to construct a filename for storing the message payload to be used if the entity is detached and stored in a separate file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.FileNameStar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that suggests how to construct filenames for storing message payloads to be used if the entities are detached and stored in a separate files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.CreationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the at which the file was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.ModificationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the at which the file was last modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.ReadDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the at which the file was last read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the approximate size, in bytes, of the file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.SetHttpFileName(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Sets both FileName and FileNameStar using encodings appropriate for HTTP headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.SetMimeFileName(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Sets the FileName parameter using encodings appropriate for MIME headers. The FileNameStar parameter is removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.Parse(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Parses as a value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue.TryParse(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the specified as a .
member.returns: if input is a valid , otherwise .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValueIdentityExtensions
member.summary: Various extension methods for for identifying the type of the disposition header

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValueIdentityExtensions.IsFileDisposition(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue)
member.summary: Checks if the content disposition header is a file disposition
member.returns: True if the header is file disposition, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValueIdentityExtensions.IsFormDisposition(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.ContentDispositionHeaderValue)
member.summary: Checks if the content disposition header is a form disposition
member.returns: True if the header is form disposition, false otherwise

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Gets the "any" etag.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.EntityTagHeaderValue.Tag
member.summary: Gets the quoted tag.

member.summary: Gets a value that determines if the entity-tag header is a weak validator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.EntityTagHeaderValue.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Check against another for equality. This equality check should not be used to determine if two values match under the RFC specifications (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3.2).
member.param: The other value to check against for equality.
member.returns: true if the strength and tag of the two values match, false if the other value is null, is not an , or if there is a mismatch of strength or tag between the two values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.EntityTagHeaderValue.Compare(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.EntityTagHeaderValue,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compares against another to see if they match under the RFC specifications (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3.2).
member.param: true to use a strong comparison, false to use a weak comparison
member.returns: true if the match for the given comparison type, false if the other value is null or the comparison failed.

member.summary: Parses as a value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities
member.summary: Provides utilities to parse and modify HTTP header values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.TryParseSeconds(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringValues,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan}@)
member.summary: Try to find a target header value among the set of given header values and parse it as a .
member.param: The containing the set of header values to search.
The target header value to look for.

When this method returns, contains the parsed , if the parsing succeeded, or null if the parsing failed. The conversion fails if the was not found or could not be parsed as a . This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.
member.returns: if is found and successfully parsed; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.ContainsCacheDirective(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringValues,System.String)
member.summary: Check if a target directive exists among the set of given cache control directives.
member.param: The containing the set of cache control directives.
The target cache control directives to look for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.TryParseNonNegativeInt32(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Try to convert a string representation of a positive number to its 64-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 64-bit signed integer value equivalent of the number contained in the string, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the string is null or String.Empty, is not of the correct format, is negative, or represents a number greater than Int64.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.TryParseNonNegativeInt64(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Try to convert a representation of a positive number to its 64-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: A containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 64-bit signed integer value equivalent of the number contained in the string, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the is null or String.Empty, is not of the correct format, is negative, or represents a number greater than Int64.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.FormatNonNegativeInt64(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts the non-negative 64-bit numeric value to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: The string representation of the value of this instance, consisting of a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 with no leading zeroes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.TryParseDate(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the specified as a value.
member.returns: if can be parsed as a date, otherwise .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.FormatDate(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Formats the using the RFC1123 format specifier.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.FormatDate(System.DateTimeOffset,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Formats the using the RFC1123 format specifier and optionally quotes it.
member.param: Determines if the formatted date should be quoted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.RemoveQuotes(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Removes quotes from the specified if quoted.
member.param: The input to remove quotes from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.IsQuoted(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Determines if the specified is quoted.
member.returns: if the value is quoted, otherwise .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.UnescapeAsQuotedString(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Given a quoted-string as defined by the RFC specification, removes quotes and unescapes backslashes and quotes. This assumes that the input is a valid quoted-string.
member.returns: An unescaped version of the quoted-string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.HeaderUtilities.EscapeAsQuotedString(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Escapes a as a quoted-string, which is defined by the RFC specification.
member.remarks: This will add a backslash before each backslash and quote and add quotes around the input. Assumes that the input does not have quotes around it, as this method will add them. Throws if the input contains any invalid escape characters, as defined by rfc7230.
member.returns: An escaped version of the quoted-string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue
member.summary: Representation of the media type header. See .

member.summary: Initializes a instance.
member.param: A representation of a media type. The text provided must be a single media type without parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a instance.
member.param: A representation of a media type. The text provided must be a single media type without parameters.
The with the quality of the media type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Charset
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the charset parameter. Returns if there is no charset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Encoding parameter. Setting the Encoding will set the to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Boundary
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the boundary parameter. Returns if there is no boundary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type's parameters. Returns an empty if there are no parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the quality parameter. Returns null if there is no quality.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the media type. Returns if there is no media type.
member.example: For the media type "application/json", the property gives the value "application/json".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the .
member.example: For the media type "application/json", the property gives the value "application".
member.remarks: See for more details on the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.SubType
member.summary: Gets the subtype of the .
member.example: For the media type "application/vnd.example+json", the property gives the value "vnd.example+json".
member.remarks: See for more details on the subtype.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.SubTypeWithoutSuffix
member.summary: Gets subtype of the , excluding any structured syntax suffix. Returns if there is no subtype without suffix.
member.example: For the media type "application/vnd.example+json", the property gives the value "vnd.example".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Suffix
member.summary: Gets the structured syntax suffix of the if it has one. See The RFC documentation on structured syntaxes.
member.example: For the media type "application/vnd.example+json", the property gives the value "json".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Facets
member.summary: Get a of facets of the . Facets are a period separated list of StringSegments in the . See The RFC documentation on facets.
member.example: For the media type "application/vnd.example+json", the property gives the value: {"vnd", "example"}

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.MatchesAllTypes
member.summary: Gets whether this matches all types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.MatchesAllSubTypes
member.summary: Gets whether this matches all subtypes.
member.example: For the media type "application/*", this property is true.
For the media type "application/json", this property is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.MatchesAllSubTypesWithoutSuffix
member.summary: Gets whether this matches all subtypes, ignoring any structured syntax suffix.
member.example: For the media type "application/*+json", this property is true.
For the media type "application/vnd.example+json", this property is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets whether the is readonly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.IsSubsetOf(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a subset of . A "subset" is defined as the same or a more specific media type according to the precedence described in https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2068.txt section 14.1, Accept.
member.returns: A value indicating whether this is a subset of .
member.remarks: For example "multipart/mixed; boundary=1234" is a subset of "multipart/mixed; boundary=1234", "multipart/mixed", "multipart/*", and "*/*" but not "multipart/mixed; boundary=2345" or "multipart/message; boundary=1234".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.Copy
member.summary: Performs a deep copy of this object and all of it's NameValueHeaderValue sub components, while avoiding the cost of re-validating the components.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.CopyAsReadOnly
member.summary: Performs a deep copy of this object and all of it's NameValueHeaderValue sub components, while avoiding the cost of re-validating the components. This copy is read-only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.MatchesMediaType(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether is a subset of this in terms of type/subType. A "subset" is defined as the same or a more specific media type according to the precedence described in https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2068.txt section 14.1, Accept.
member.returns: A value indicating whether is a subset of this .
member.remarks: For example "multipart/mixed" is a subset of "multipart/mixed", "multipart/*", and "*/*" but not "multipart/message."

member.summary: Takes a media type and parses it into the and its associated parameters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValueComparer
member.summary: Implementation of that can compare accept media type header fields based on their quality values (a.k.a q-values).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValueComparer.QualityComparer
member.summary: Gets the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValueComparer.Compare(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue,Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue)
member.remarks: Performs comparisons based on the arguments' quality values (aka their "q-value"). Values with identical q-values are considered equal (i.e. the result is 0) with the exception that suffixed subtype wildcards are considered less than subtype wildcards, subtype wildcards are considered less than specific media types and full wildcards are considered less than subtype wildcards. This allows callers to sort a sequence of following their q-values in the order of specific media types, subtype wildcards, and last any full wildcards.
member.example: If we had a list of media types (comma separated): { text/*;q=0.8, text/*+json;q=0.8, */*;q=1, */*;q=0.8, text/plain;q=0.8 } Sorting them using Compare would return: { */*;q=0.8, text/*;q=0.8, text/*+json;q=0.8, text/plain;q=0.8, */*;q=1 }

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SameSiteMode
member.summary: Indicates if the client should include a cookie on "same-site" or "cross-site" requests. RFC Draft: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-rfc6265bis-03#section-4.1.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SameSiteMode.Unspecified
member.summary: No SameSite field will be set, the client should follow its default cookie policy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SameSiteMode.None
member.summary: Indicates the client should disable same-site restrictions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SameSiteMode.Lax
member.summary: Indicates the client should send the cookie with "same-site" requests, and with "cross-site" top-level navigations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SameSiteMode.Strict
member.summary: Indicates the client should only send the cookie with "same-site" requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue
member.summary:
Represents the Set-Cookie header.
See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265 for the Set-Cookie header specification.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment,Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives.StringSegment)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the cookie name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the cookie value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Expires
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the Expires cookie attribute.
The Expires attribute indicates the maximum lifetime of the cookie, represented as the date and time at which the cookie expires.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.MaxAge
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the Max-Age cookie attribute.
The Max-Age attribute indicates the maximum lifetime of the cookie, represented as the number of seconds until the cookie expires.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Domain
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the Domain cookie attribute.
The Domain attribute specifies those hosts to which the cookie will be sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Path
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the Path cookie attribute.
The path attribute specifies those hosts to which the cookie will be sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Secure
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the Secure cookie attribute.
The Secure attribute limits the scope of the cookie to "secure" channels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.SameSite
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the SameSite cookie attribute.
"SameSite" cookies offer a robust defense against CSRF attack when deployed in strict mode, and when supported by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.HttpOnly
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the HttpOnly cookie attribute.
HttpOnly instructs the user agent to omit the cookie when providing access to cookies via "non-HTTP" APIs (such as a web browser API that exposes cookies to scripts).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.SetCookieHeaderValue.Extensions
member.summary: Gets a collection of additional values to append to the cookie.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.StringWithQualityHeaderValueComparer
member.summary: Implementation of that can compare content negotiation header fields based on their quality values (a.k.a q-values). This applies to values used in accept-charset, accept-encoding, accept-language and related header fields with similar syntax rules. See for a comparer for media type q-values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.StringWithQualityHeaderValueComparer.QualityComparer
member.summary: Gets the default instance of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.StringWithQualityHeaderValueComparer.Compare(Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.StringWithQualityHeaderValue,Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.StringWithQualityHeaderValue)
member.summary: Compares two based on their quality value (a.k.a their "q-value"). Values with identical q-values are considered equal (i.e the result is 0) with the exception of wild-card values (i.e. a value of "*") which are considered less than non-wild-card values. This allows to sort a sequence of following their q-values ending up with any wild-cards at the end.
